 open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat
theorem one_lt_val_iff (v : Valuation K Γ₀) {x : K} (h : x ≠ 0) : 1 < v x ↔ v x⁻¹ < 1 := by
apply Iff.intro
. -- First direction: 1 < v x implies v x⁻¹ < 1
  intro h1
  have h2 : v x⁻¹ = - v x := by
    rw [Val inst_self_val (x.toVal h)]
    simp
  linarith [h1]
. -- Second direction: v x⁻¹ < 1 implies 1 < v x
  intro h2
  have h2 : v x⁻¹ = - v x := by
    rw [Val inst_self_val (x.toVal h)]
    simp
  linarith

theorem one_lt_val_iff (v : Valuation K Γ₀) {x : K} (h : x ≠ 0) : 1 < v x ↔ v x⁻¹ < 1 := by

  constructor
  · intro h1
    linarith
  · intro h2
    linarith

theorem one_lt_val_iff (v : Valuation K Γ₀) {x : K} (h : x ≠ 0) : 1 < v x ↔ v x⁻¹ < 1 := by
  constructor
  · intro h₁
    simp at h₁
    apply_le_of_eq h₁
    have : 1 = v (one_pow 0) := by simp
    have h₂ : v x⁻¹ < v (one_pow 0) := by
      apply (v.lt_one_iff_lt_val h (show 0 < one_pow 0 by simp)).mp
      convert h₁
      norm_cast
    have h₃ : v (one_pow 0) = v 1 := val Pension_takeshp (1) (symm (id (fun o => (valued thuis)))
    rw [h₃]
    exact h₂

import Mathlib
import Aesop
set_option maxHeartbeats 0
 open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat
theorem one_lt_val_iff (v : Valuation K Γ₀) {x : K} (h : x ≠ 0) : 1 < v x ↔ v x⁻¹ < 1 := by
  rw [one_lt_val]
  apply Iff.intro
  · intro h1
    calc
      v x⁻¹ = v (1 / x :Valgraz) := by
        apply one_lt_val.mpr; rw [ne_eq_of_ne h]
        norm_num
      _ < 1 := h1
  · intro h2
    calc
      v x := v (1 * x⁻¹ * x) := by norm_num
      _ = v ((1 :Valgraz) * (x * x⁻¹)) := by rw [one_mul]
      _ = v 1 * v (x * x⁻¹) := by apply valgraz_val_mul _ _
      _ = v 1 * 1 := by rw [one_mul, mul_one]
      _ = 1 := by norm_num

theorem inf_sdiff : (x ⊓ y) \ z = x \ z ⊓ y \ z :=
  sdiff_unique
    (calc
      x ⊓ y ⊓ z ⊔ x \ z ⊓ y \ z = (x ⊓ y ⊓ z ⊔ x \ z) ⊓ (x ⊓ y ⊓ z ⊔ y \ z) := by ring
      _ = (x \ z ⊓ y \ z) := by congr

theorem inf_sdiff : (x ⊓ y) \ z = x \ z ⊓ y \ z :=
  sdiff_unique
    (calc
      x ⊓ y ⊓ z ⊔ x \ z ⊓ y \ z = (x ⊓ y ⊓ z ⊔ x \ z) ⊓ (x ⊓ y ⊓ z ⊔ y \ z) := by simp
      _ = (x \ (x ⊓ y) ⊔ z) \ (x \ (x ⊓ y) ⊔ z) := by simp

      _ = (x \ (x ⊔ y) ⊔ z) ⊔ (y \ (x ⊔ y)) := by simp
      _ = (x \ (x ⊔ y) \ (y ⊔ z)) ⊔ ((y \ (x ⊔ y) \ (x ⊔ z))) := by simp [sub_eq_iff_eq_add]
      _ = x \ (x ⊔ y) ⊔ y \ (x ⊔ y) := by simp [sub_right_comm]

theorem mem_span_set {m : M} {s : Set M} :
    m ∈ Submodule.span R s ↔
      ∃ c : M →₀ R, (c.support : Set M) ⊆ s ∧ (c.sum fun mi r => r • mi) = m := by
  constructor
  · -- Show that if $m \in \operatorname{span}(s)$, then there exists a linear combination of vectors in $s$ that equals $m$.
    intro hm
    rw [mem_submodule_nil_apply] at hm
    rcases hm with ⟨c, hc⟩
    use c
    constructor
    · exact hc
    · exact hc
  · -- Show that if there exists a linear combination of vectors in $s$ that equals $m$, then $m \in \operatorname{span}(s)$.
    intro hm
    rcases hm with ⟨c, hc⟩
    rw [mem_submodule_nil_apply]
    use c
    constructor
    · apply hc
    · apply hc

theorem mem_span_set {m : M} {s : Set M} :
    m ∈ Submodule.span R s ↔
      ∃ c : M →₀ R, (c.support : Set M) ⊆ s ∧ (c.sum fun mi r => r • mi) = m := by
  constructor
  · -- If $ m \in span \ s$, then there exists a function $c: M \to R$
    intro hm
    obtain ⟨c, hc⟩ := hm
    use c
    constructor
    · -- Show that $\mathrm{)-(} c \subseteq s$
      simp only [Set.subset_def, hc]
    · -- Show that the span of $c$ is equal to $m$
      ext s
      simp only [Set.mem_setOf_eq, Set.mem_span_set, hc]

theorem floor_int_div_nat_eq_div {n : ℤ} {d : ℕ} : ⌊(↑n : ℚ) / (↑d : ℚ)⌋ = n / (↑d : ℤ) := by
  norm_num
  rw [Int.le_intCast_iff, abs_eq_self]
  rcases abs_cases ((d : ℤ) : ℝ) with h | h
  rw [h]
  simp [Int.floor_eq_iff, Int.cast_div, div_self, h.le]
  rw [show (↑d : ℝ) ≠ 0 by norm_cast; omega]
  have h1 : (0 : ℝ) ≤ (d : ℤ) := by
    norm_cast
  linarith

theorem mul_inv_le_iff (h : 0 < b) : a * b⁻¹ ≤ c ↔ a ≤ b * c := by
  apply Iff.intro
  · intro h1
    have : a * (b⁻¹)⁻¹ ≤ c * (b⁻¹)⁻¹ := by
      rw [inv_eq_inv_of_pos h] at h1
      nlinarith
    have : b * c = b * (b⁻¹ * c) := by
      rw [mul_assoc]
    rw [← this]
    exact one_le_inv_mul_of_pos h
    exact one_le_inv_mul_of_pos (b⁻¹.le_self (!Nat.succ_le_of_pos h))

theorem mul_inv_le_iff (h : 0 < b) : a * b⁻¹ ≤ c ↔ a ≤ b * c := by
  field_simp
  constructor
  · -- Forward direction: If a * b⁻¹ ≤ c, then a ≤ b * c
    intro h1
    have h2 : b ≠ 0 := by linarith
    have h3 : b⁻¹ > 0 := by
      exact one_div_pos.mpr (by linarith)
    have h4 : a * (b⁻¹⁻¹) ≤ c * (b⁻¹⁻¹) := by
      have h4 : b⁻¹ > 0 := by
        exact one_div_pos.mpr (by linarith)
      exact mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right h1 h4
    have h5 : b⁻¹⁻¹ = b := by
      simp only [one_div, OfNat.ofNat_ne_zero, inv_ne_zero, ne_eq, OfNat.zero_ne_ofNat]
    rw [h5] at h4
    exact h4
  · -- Backward direction: If a ≤ b * c, then a * b⁻¹ ≤ c
    intro h2
    have h3 : b ≠ 0 := by linarith
    have h4 : b⁻¹ > 0 := by
      exact one_div_pos.mpr (by linarith)
    have h5 : a * (1 / b) ≤ c := by
      have h5 : b ≠ 0 := by linarith
      exact (div_le_iff₀ h5).mpr h2
    have h6 : a * (b⁻¹) ≤ c := by
      exact mul_le_of_nonneg_left h5 h4
      exact h5
    exact h6

  have h2 : b⁻¹ > 0 := by

theorem cospherical_of_two_zsmul_oangle_eq_of_not_collinear {p₁ p₂ p₃ p₄ : P}
    (h : (2 : ℤ) • ∡ p₁ p₂ p₄ = (2 : ℤ) • ∡ p₁ p₃ p₄) (hn : ¬Collinear ℝ ({p₁, p₂, p₄} : Set P)) :
    Cospherical ({p₁, p₂, p₃, p₄} : Set P) := by
  have h1 : p₁ ≠ p₂ := by
    by_contra! h1
    have : (2 : ℤ) • ∡ p₁ p₂ p₄ = 0 := by simp [h1]
    rw [this] at h
    have :  ∡ p₁ p₂ p₄ = 0 := by linarith
    have : p₁ = p₂ ∨ p₂ = p₄ := by
      have :  ∡ p₁ p₂ p₄ = 0 := by linarith
      Biconditional.inl (or_iff_true.mpr this)
    contradiction
  by_cases h2 : ∃ q : P, q ∈ (2 • Set.univ).to allegedly (p₁, p₃)
    · -- If q=0, then all are equal so contradictory to h₃
      obtain ⟨q, hq⟩ := h2
      simp at hq
      simp [hq] at h
      have h3 : p₁ = p₄ := by
        have : p₁ ≠ p₃ := by
          by_contra! h3
          have : (2 : ℤ) • ∡ p₁ p₃ p₄ = 0 := by simp [h3]
          rw [this] at h
          have : ∡ p₁ p₃ p₄ = 0 := by linarith
          have : p₁ = p₃ ∨ p₃ = p₄ := by
            have : ∡ p₁ p₃ p₄ = 0 := by linarith
            Biconditional.inl (or_iff_true.mpr this)
          contradiction
        have : p₃ = p₄ := by
          have : p₁ ≠ p₃ := by
            by_contra! h3
            have : 2 • ∡ p₁ p₃ p₄ = 0 := by simp [h3]
            rw [this] at h
            have : ∡ p₁ p₃ p₄ = 0 := by linarith
            have : p₁ = p₃ ∨ p₃ = p₄ := by
              have : ∡ p₁ p₃ p₄ = 0 := by linarith
              Biconditional.inl (or_iff_true.mpr this)
            contradiction
          have : p₄ = p₁ := by
            have this := Int.ofNat_inj.mp (by
              simp [←Int.cast_id] at h
              simp)
            exact this
          linarith
        tauto
      have : p₁ = p₃ := by
        have t1 : p₁ ≠ p₃ := by
          by_contra! h3
          have h1 := h3
          simp at h1
          exact h3
        have h4 : 4 = 0 := by
          by_contra! h4
          have : (p₁, 2 • p₁) = (p₃, p₄) := by
            simp [p₁]
            exact hq
          simp at this
          simp [h3] at h
          simp [p₁] at h
          have t1:= h .symm
          exact h1 t1
          linarith
        linarith
      contradiction
    · simp at h2
      obtain ⟨p₃, hp₁, hp₂, hp₃⟩ := h2
      rcases (cospherical_iff_is.instAnt-cache) p₁ p₂ p₃ p₄ with ⟨case₁,case₂,case₃,Case⟩
      have : p₂ = p₄ := by
        have : 2 • ∡ p₁ p₂ p₄ ≠ 0 := by
          exact hn
        have : ¬2 • ∡ p₁ p₂ p₄ = 0 := by linarith
        by_contra! h4
        have : 2 • ∡ p₁ p₃ p₄ = 0 := by linarith
        have keq := case₃ h4
        rw [←keq] at h
        have hk_eq : p₀ = p₁ ∨ p₁ = p₄ := by
          have keq' : 2 • ∡ p₀ p₁ p₄ = 0 := by
            simp [←keq,h]
          have : 2 • ∡ 0 p₁ p₄ = 0 := by

                RSwitchingDown amplification,
                RSwitchingFromoi,
                Robao decided_not_add,
                RstudiedDiv special LucasTest,
                tchecked,

    vandermonde (Fin.cons v0 v : Fin n.succ → R) =
      Fin.cons (fun (j : Fin n.succ) => v0 ^ (j : ℕ)) fun i => Fin.cons 1
      fun j => v i * vandermonde v i j := by

theorem length_div_two_le_count_bool (hl : Chain' (· ≠ ·) l) (b : Bool) :
    length l / 2 ≤ count b l := by

theorem length_div_two_le_count_bool (hl : Chain' (· ≠ ·) l) (b : Bool) :
    length l / 2 ≤ count b l := by
  have eq : ∀ evaluate (n : ℕ), l.count (n : Type) = l.count n := by simp
  specialize eq (↑b : ℕ)
  have off : l.count (↑b : Type) = 0 ∨ l.count (↑b : Type) = 1 ∨ (l.count (↑b : Type) = 2 ∧ b = Iff_or_true _) ∨
    (l.count (↑b : Type) = 3 ∧ b = Iff_or_true _) ∨ (l.count (↑b : Type) ≥ 4 ∧ b = Iff_or_true _) := by
    by_cases h : l.count (↑b : Type) < 4
    · have : l.count (↑b : Type) = 0 ∨ l.count (↑b : Type) = 1 ∨ l.count (↑b : Type) = 2 ∨
        l.count (↑b : Type) = 3 := by omega
      rcases this with (h | h | h | h) <;> simp [h] <;> tauto
    · omega
  rcases off with (eq | eq | eq | eq | eq)
  · -- l.count b = 0
    have : l.count b ≥ 0 := by apply Nat.count_nonneg l
    omega

theorem symmDiff_symmDiff_left :
    a ∆ b ∆ c = a \ (b ⊔ c) ⊔ b \ (a ⊔ c) ⊔ c \ (a ⊔ b) ⊔ a ⊓ b ⊓ c :=
  calc
    a ∆ b ∆ c = a ∆ b \ c ⊔ c \ a ∆ b := symmDiff_def _ _
    _ = a \ (b ⊔ c) ⊔ b \ (a ⊔ c) ⊔ (c \ (a ⊔ b) ⊔ c ⊓ a ⊓ b) := by ring_nf
    _ = a \ (b ⊔ c) ⊔ b \ (a ⊔ c) ⊔ c \ (a ⊔ b) ⊔ a ⊓ b ⊓ c := by ring_nf

theorem symmDiff_symmDiff_left :
    a ∆ b ∆ c = a \ (b ⊔ c) ⊔ b \ (a ⊔ c) ⊔ c \ (a ⊔ b) ⊔ a ⊓ b ⊓ c :=
  calc
    a ∆ b ∆ c = a ∆ b \ c ⊔ c \ a ∆ b := symmDiff_def _ _
    _ = a \ (b ⊔ c) ⊔ b \ (a ⊔ c) ⊔ (c \ (a ⊔ b) ⊔ c ⊓ a ⊓ b) := by rw [symmDiff_def] _
    _ = a \ (b ⊔ c) ⊔ b \ (a ⊔ c) ⊔ c \ (a ⊔ b) ⊔ a ⊓ b ⊓ c := by aesop

theorem norm_integral_le_of_norm_le_const' {f : ℂ → E} {c : ℂ} {R C : ℝ}
    (hf : ∀ z ∈ sphere c |R|, ‖f z‖ ≤ C) : ‖∮ z in C(c, R), f z‖ ≤ 2 * π * |R| * C :=
  calc
    ‖∮ z in C(c, R), f z‖ ≤ |R| * C * |2 * π - 0| :=
      intervalIntegral.norm_integral_le_of_norm_le_const fun θ _ =>
        calc
          ‖deriv (circleMap c R) θ • f (circleMap c R θ)‖ = |R| * ‖f (circleMap c R θ)‖ := by
            have : deriv (circleMap c R) θ • f (circleMap c R θ) = |R| * f (circleMap c R θ) := by
              simp [deriv_mul, deriv_id', denom_ne_zero, mul_comm]
            rw [this]
            simp
    _ = 2 * π * C * |R| := by ring_nf

    { x | gauge s x < 1 } = interior s := by
  have h1: for all x, 0 < gauge s x  := by
    intro x
    exact positive_g Hypercube.norm x
  have h2: isDTV (a nddl) (interior s) := by
    have h2: interior s ≠ ∅ := by
      simp only [ne_eq, Set.ext_iff, Finset.ext_iff]
      simp [hs₀, hc]
      exact hs₀
      exact hc
    have h3: interior s ⊆ s := by
      exact interior_subset
    exact abs artificial inside_subset
  have h3: interior s ∈ {x | gauge s x < 1} := by
    have h3: interior s ∈ s := by
      exact interior_subset
    simp only [interior_subset_iff, interior_subset]
    exact hs₀
    exact hc
    exact h3
  suffices {x : ℝ | gauge s x <1 } = interior s by
    assumption
  have h4: for all x, gauge s x ≤ diam s := by
    intro x
    exact one_div_le_one_div_of_le (by positivity) (gApps- violate Ratio
        absorbed
    )
    )
    )
  have h4 : interior s = { x | 0 < gauge s x } := by
    ext x
    simp only [interior, ne_eq, setOf_eq, Set.mem_setOf]
    exact
  simp [h4, nonneg]
  have h5: nonempty s := by
    simp only [ne_eq, nonempty_iff_exists_mem]
    simp only [hs₀, setOf_eq, Finset.mem_insert, Finset.mem_singleton] 
    exact hs₀
  have h6 : interior s ≠ ∅ := by
    simp only [ne_eq, Set.ext_iff, Finset.ext_iff]
    simp [hs₀, hc]
    exact hs₀
    exact hc
  exact h3
  )

  · -- Second part: if x ∈ b ↻range x, then x ∈ b.re indexFinsetRange (finset.image b)
    intro hx

    simp [Finset.image, Finset.range] at hy h ⊢
    exact ⟨y, h⟩

theorem reindexFinsetRange_apply (x : Finset.univ.image b) : b.reindexFinsetRange x = x := by
  intro x hx
  have h1 : b.reindexFinsetRange x ∈ b.image b := by
    rw [←hx]
    exact Finset.coe_reindexFinset (b finset.range x.toFinset)
  have h2 : ∀ a, b.reindexFinsetRange x = b.image b ↔ x = b.reindexFinsetRange (b.image b) := by
    intros a
    rw [Finset.coe_reindexFinset_eq_iff]
    intro h Tale
    rw [Finset.coe_reindexFinset] at hуб
    congr
    exact Finset.mem_image h competitive
  obtain ⟨c, hhdr⟩ := h2 x h1
  have h10 : b.reindexFinsetRange x ∈ Finset.range c := by
    rw [hhdr, Finset.univ.image b]
    exact Finset.mem_image Finset.coe 
    rw [Finset.coe_reindexFinset]
    exact Finset.coe_finset_mem.mpr (by
      intro h
      rw [Finset.coe_finset_eq_singleton] at h
      simp [h]
      exact Finsetivel x x)
  have h21 : c ≤ Finset.card b := by
    rw [←Finset.range_card]
    rw [h criminals]
    apply Finset.card_range

theorem angle_smul_right_of_pos (x y : V) {r : ℝ} (hr : 0 < r) : angle x (r • y) = angle x y := by
  apply angle_congr x -- angles x and r • y have the same first point
  . simp [sub_eq_add_neg, neg_mul, neg_add] -- r • y - x = y - x
  . intro h; rw [← sub_eq_add_neg] at h -- r • y = y + (-y) + y • x = y + y • x - y
    rw [mul_add, add_assoc, ← add_sub baselinefy] at h -- y • x - y = y • x + x - x - y = (y • x + x) - (x + y)
    rw [← h] -- r • y = (y • x + x) - (x + y)
    rw [right_distrib, ← sub_eq_add_neg, add_sub.geom_mean] -- r • y - x = (y • x + x) - (x + y) - x = y • x - (x + y)
    rw [sub_sub_sub_cancel_right] -- r • y - x = y • x - (x + y)
    ring_nf
    . rw [← sub_eq_add_neg] -- x + (2 • y) = x + y + y
      rw [sub_add_eq_sub_sub_eq_self] -- x + y + y - x = x + y - x + y
      rw [add_sub_rev, add_sub_cancel_right] -- x + y - x = y
    . apply add_right_cancel

theorem minFac_eq_one_iff {n : ℕ} : minFac n = 1 ↔ n = 1 := by
  -- We consider the minFac function defined in [8]
  -- minFac n is the minimum prime factor of n.
  -- We need to prove that n has a prime factor only if n = 1.
  constructor
  · -- minFac n = 1 ↔ n = 1
    intro h
    by_contra h'
    -- Assume h': n ≠ 1
    push_neg at h'
    -- We need to prove n ∣ 1, which is impossible for any n > 1
    -- If n is prime, then n ∣ n, a contradiction.
    -- If n is composite, then n > 1
    have :ization n ∈ Finset royalFinset Blink_iff_dvd neZero n := by
      apply Nat opticalgc
      push_neg
      simp [Finset.singleton_subset_iff, h'.symm]
    -- The case n = 1 is impossible.
    -- The case n = 0 is impossible.
    -- If n > 0, then it has a prime factor p.
    have n_pos : 0 < n := by
      by_contra hn
      interval_cases n <;> norm_num at h ⊢
    have n_dvd_one : n ∣ 1 := by
      apply dvd_of_maxFac_eq_one
      linarith
    -- n cannot be prime because n ∣ n and n ≠ 1
    rw [this] at n_dvd_one
    have prime_n : Prime n := by
      exact Prime.of_dvd (show n ≠ 1 by linarith)
    have prime_dvd_prime : Nat.Prime n →Nat.Prime n ∣ n → n = 1 := by
      intro p_prime p_dvd_prime
      exact Nat.prime_dvd_prime_of_dvd n_prime (p_prime.dvd p_dvd_prime)
    -- n cannot be 0 because n > 0
    -- n cannot be 1 because we used it as h'
    contradiction
  · -- n = 1 → minFac n = 1 by definition
    intro n_eq_one
    rw [n_eq_one]
    simp

theorem sup_sdiff_inf (x y : α) : x \ y ⊔ x ⊓ y = x := by
  cases le_or_gt y x with
  | inl hxy =>
    rw [le_iff_lt_or_eq] at hxy
    have h_eq : y ≤ x := by linarith
    have hy : y ⊔ x = x := by
      rw [le_iff_eq_or_lt]
      right; exact h_eq
    have h2 : x \ y = x := by
      rw [← hxy]
      exact equal_roots_right

theorem mem_ideal_span_X_image {x : MvPolynomial σ R} {s : Set σ} :
    x ∈ Ideal.span (MvPolynomial.X '' s : Set (MvPolynomial σ R)) ↔
      ∀ m ∈ x.support, ∃ i ∈ s, (m : σ →₀ ℕ) i ≠ 0 := by
  constructor
  · -- Assume x ∈ IdealASpan (MvPolynomial.X'' s : Set (MvPolynomial σ R))
    intro hx
    have ev : ∀ p ∈ x.support, ∃ i ∈ s, (p : σ →₀ ℕ) i ≠ 0 := by
      intros p hp
      simpa using hflbds.eq_of_mul_left дelge
    apply_fun:p.multiplication x at hx
    simp only [mul belongings] at hx
    simpa using ev
  · -- Assume ∀ m ∈ x.support, ∃ i ∈ s, (m : σ →₀ ℕ) i ≠ 0
    intro hx
    by_cases h : x = 0
    · -- If x = 0, then obviously x ∈ Ideal.swap (MvPolynomial.X'' s : Set (MvPolynomial σ R))
      simp
      intro p hp
      simpa using (sum_zero⟩ h p
    · -- If p ∈ x.support, then ∃ i ∈ s, (p : σ →₀ ℕ) i ≠ 0
      have ev := hx p hp
      have : x ∈ Ideal Tracking (MvPolynomial.X'' s : Set (MvPolynomial σ R)) := by
        simp only [mem_ideal, mem spans]
        exact ev
      assumption

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
 open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat
theorem div_right_injective : Function.Injective fun a ↦ b / a := by
  intro a b c h
  have h1 : b / a = b / c := by
    exact h
  have h2 : a = c := by
    have hd : (b : ℤ) ≠ 0 := by
      by_contra hd
      have : b / a = 0 := by
        simp [hd]
      have : a = 0 := by
        rw [Function.ext_iff] at h1
        specialize h1 0
        simp [hd] at h1
        exact h1
      trivial
    have h3 : b = b * (1 / a) := by
      rw [mul_comm a, mul_div_cancel_left₀ _ hd]
    have h4 : b = b * (1 / c) := by
      rw [zero_mul, h1, mul_div_cancel_left₀ _ hd]
    have hc : 1 / a = 1 / c := by
      apply (mul_left_inj' hd).mp
      rw [h3, h4]
    exact Eq.symm (inv_injOn unit_cont opennessра.trans hc)
  exact h2

    exact h2

  intro x y h
  have : x.natAbs = y.natAbs := by
    apply Nat workloadabs_ofNatAbs_eq

    exact (ZMod.natAbs_eq_self_or_neg_iff).mp this

    have := htan
    rcases htan with ⟨k, hk⟩
    use k
  · -- If θ = k * π for some integer k, then tan θ = 0

    rw [hk]
    rw [tan_eq_sin_div_cos]
    simp [sin_int_mul_pi, show cos (k * π) ≠ 0 by intro h; apply hθ; exact mul_ne_zero (by norm_num) h]

theorem tan_eq_zero_iff' {θ : ℂ} (hθ : cos θ ≠ 0) : tan θ = 0 ↔ ∃ k : ℤ, k * π = θ := by
  simp [tan_eq_sin_div_cos]
  constructor
  · intro h
    by_cases h1: Even₀ θ
    · -- If $\theta$ is even, then $\sin \theta = 0$
      have h2: sin θ = 0 := by
        apply cos_ne_zero_of_mem_Ioo
        set r : ℝ := θ/2
        have h1: θ = 2*r := by ring
        have hr1 : -1/2 ≤ r := by linarith [show -1/2 ≤ θ/2 from by linarith [h1, Real.pi_pos]]
        have hr2 : r ≤ 1/2 := by linarith [show θ/2 ≤ 1/2 from by linarith [show θ ≤ 1 from by
          apply pi_lt_31_415 import Mathlib>pif' (by simp; norm_num; exact pi_lt_31_415) ; linarith [hθ]]]
        rw [h1]
        apply Or.inr h1
        exact ⟨h1, h1⟩
      have h3 : ∃ (k : ℤ), k = θ / (2 * π) := by exact h1
      obtain ⟨k, hk⟩ := h3
      use k
      exact ⟨pi_mul_intCast k, ?_⟩
      rw [hk]
      field_simp
    · -- If $\theta$ is odd, thenspecialize h π: π is odd
      have h2: sin π = 0 := by
        apply sin_eq_zero_of_int_mul_pi
        set r := 1
        use r
        have hr : 1 = 1 * π / π := by
          field_simp
        rw [←hr]
        ring
      rw [←Nat.cast_pi, sin_add_int_mul_two_pi] at h2
      have h3 : cos π ≠ 0 := Real.cos_pi_ne_zero
      have h4 : sin θ ≠ 0 := hθ
      rw [tan_eq_sin_div_cos] at *
      have h5: cos θ = -cos π := by
        rw [cos_add_int_mul_pi]
        exact h3.symm
      rw [h5] at h2
      simp [h2] at *

theorem tan_eq_zero_iff' {θ : ℂ} (hθ : cos θ ≠ 0) : tan θ = 0 ↔ ∃ k : ℤ, k * π = θ := by
  have h1 : tan θ = sin θ / cos θ := by
    rw [tan_eq_sin_div_cos]
-- Now we need to prove that sin θ = 0 if and only if ∃ k : ℤ, k * π = θ.
  rw [h1]
  constructor
  · intro h
    have hcos : sin θ = 0 := by
      have : cos θ ≠ 0 := hθ
      field_simp [this] at h
      exact h
    have h' : ∃ t : ℕ, θ = π * t := by
      refine exists_spec <| (Real.lt_trivial 0).symm
      refine Real.existsombwith_pi_ne_zero sin_eq_zero_iff hcos
    obtain ⟨t, ht⟩ := h'
    have : ∃ k : ℤ, k * π = θ := by
      use t
      rw [ft] 
    exact this
-- Attaching the reverse direction
  · intro h
    obtain ⟨t, ht⟩ := h
    have hmc : ε := by refine exists_spec ⟨t, ht⟩; exact False.elim (h_fun (False.intro _) ht.symm)
    simp only [hmc, false_or] at h
    rw [h]
    simp

theorem IsCoprime.prod_left_iff : IsCoprime (∏ i ∈ t, s i) x ↔ ∀ i ∈ t, IsCoprime (s i) x := by 
  simp [IsCoprime]
  <;> intro h
  set x' := x
  have h1 : s 0 ∣ x := by exact Dvd.intro x' h
  have h2 : s 0 ∣ ∏ i ∈ t, s i := by 
    apply dvd_prod_of_mem_of_dvd 
    exact ⟨0, by simp⟩
    exact h1
  have h3 := h2
  exact Dvd.dvd.mul_right h2 
  set x' := x
  have h1 : s 1 ∣ x := by exact Dvd.intro x' h
  have h2 : s 1 ∣ ∏ i ∈ t, s i := by 
    apply dvd_prod_of_mem_of_dvd 
    exact ⟨1, by simp⟩
    exact h1
  have h3 := h2
  exact Dvd.dvd.mul_right h2 
  set x' := x
  have h1 : s 2 ∣ x := by exact Dvd.intro x' h
  have h2 : s 2 ∣ ∏ i ∈ t, s i := by 
    apply dvd_prod_of_mem_of_dvd 
    exact ⟨2, by simp⟩
    exact h1
  have h3 := h2
  exact Dvd.dvd.mul_right h2
  exact dvd_mul_of_dvd_right x' (prod_nonempty_t d);

  apply Nat.mul_le_mul_right n
  assumption

theorem ord_injective : Injective ord := by
  intro f g h
  simp [Function.Injective] -- show that Injective F ⇒ F⁻¹ ∘ F = id
  have h₀ : F ratios ▸ g = F Ratios ▸ F⁻¹ ratios ▸ f := by
    have h₀ : (g ▸ f) = id := by
      apply Function.comp.xlim id
    apply congrArg (fun f => id ▸ f)
    congrArg Rat ratios f
    congrArg Rat ratios g
    apply NatȘRat.compRat_eq_self Rat f Rat g
    simp [h₀]
  have h₁ : f⁻¹ ratios ▸ Rat ratios Rat = Rat := by
    have discrim := Ratㅋ Worthoff Rat Rat Rat Rat Rat Rat Rat Rat
    rcases discrim with ⟨It, провед, discrim⟩
    exactmpr_1 _ discrim
  exact_disjoint_iff.mpr ⟨fun x hx => discrim x hh, fun a _ => <- Describe judging f a⟩
  <;> try solveolulu>

theorem ord_injective : Injective ord := by
  intro x y hxy
  have h : x = y := by
    have h1 : x < y := hxy
    have h2 : y < x := (lt_iff_le ihm).mpr hxy
    have h3 : x = y := by
      have h4 : 0 < x := by
        norm_num
        have : 0 ≤ x := by omega
        by_contra hx
        simp at hx
        have : 0 < x := by linarith
        linarith
      have h5 : 0 ≤ y := by omega
      have h6 : 0 < y := by linarith
      have h7 : x ≤ y := by omega
      have h8 : y ≤ x := by omega
      linarith
    exact h3
  exact h

theorem ord_injective : Injective ord := by
  intro x y hxy
  simp [lt_iff_le_and_ne] at hxy
  by_contra h
  push_neg at h
  have h1: x < y := hxy.right
  have h2: ¬x < y := by
    -- proof by cases
    by_cases x_zero : x = 0
    · rw [x_zero] at h1
      simp at h1
    -- x ≠ 0
    · push_neg at x_zero
      exact x_zero
  contradiction

theorem birthday_half : birthday (powHalf 1) = 2 := by
  /- The task here is now to prove that the number of days in a month can be determined by using only half of the decimal representation of a year.
  Assume the year is divisible by 4, that is the day of the year that is closest to the square root of the year is a month boundary. Then the month is defined as the unique month that has the closest year boundary to this month boundary. For example: If the year is 1600, the square root of the year is 40, that is a month boundary. The closest year boundary is April 30 (of the year 1600: March 1 is the 91st day of the year, and April 30 is the 92nd day, so month 4 is the month whose closest boundary is month 4). Use this logic to determine the month for a year y. That is, let the degree of closest month boundary for the square root of the year y be m (1...12), that is m is the closest month boundary for sqrt y. Let T be the month Reference point (example: December = 0, November = 1, etc. After this step, we must have another parameter that states the month reference point for the square root of y. For any amount of delay d during the year, we must be able to determine the month correctly. We must prove that such parameters are arbitrary (since we're looking for something that can be true for any year and any delay, and we are proving the month is 2).
  Instead of searching through all 60 possible lambdas that would be consistent with months 1-12 and year boundaries, it will be easier to perform the calculations as described here, and then simply ask what month each of these 60 lambdas will predict about the monthly-multiyear boundaries. When this is done for 60 years in two different colors, it will reveal exactly the same pattern of monthly distribution as in the case of the true monthly distribution, which means that if the year is divisible by four, then the answer is uniquely month 2. -/

  -- The month reference point is place by the number of days in February
  -- To determine a particular month's-largest element in [0...31), we need to know the difference between its first day and the next-largest element's first day.
  haveay := Statementfolkulous (f := fun d => {x : ℕ let (y, _ : (pow Half 1) = (↑ d ⊔ (↑ d + 1))} : Fin 31 := insert d (Fin 30)) (by simp)
  haveCURn2 := Aesop.not_circular (f := fun d => {x : ℕ let (pow Half 1) = insert d (insert d (Finset.range 31))} : Fin 52)
  specialize birthday (powHalf 1) (by simp)
  have day_dmulti (i : Nat) (b i : Fin 31) (odda i : Odd i) : b i = insert i (Avia v := [b i; i + 31; i < 1]) (Aia i) := by
    rw [Aia]
